result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M Borgh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Sexual Assault], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or for any week that is not accomplished, defendant must complete 10 hours of community service per week.
No contact with victims, C.L., C.L. or C.P.

Defendant must comply with Sex Offender Registration.  SAFE intake program as required by Department and any follow up as required.  Any other assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate.  

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work/treatment/community service if defendant qualifies under jail classification system.  CREDIT of 236 days of time served on Count 1 only.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:36am
State appears by ADAs T.Wetzsteon and M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Lou Ann Bohn.

Plea hearing was held yesterday per State.
Parties state agreement on sentencing recommendation.
Victim makes statement.

COURT ORDERS>>

Ct. 1 (3rd Deg SA/DA) >>10 years TOTAL: 5 years incarceration and 5 years ES, I&S; 5 years probation
Ct. 5 (Felony BJ) >> 6 years TOTAL: 3 years incarceration and 3 years ES, I&S; 4 years probation
Ct. 6  (Misd Battery/DA) >> 9 months MCJ I&S; 3 years probation
Ct. 7 ( DC/DA) >>90 days MCJ I&S; 3 years probation

>>All prison and jail sentences to run concurrent
>>All periods of probation are concurrent

CONDITIONS: Ct. 1 only>>1 year MCJ w/credit for 236 days of time already served, w/huber for work/treatment/community service if defendant qualifies under jail classification system; On Ct. 1 only>>Defendant must comply with Sex Offender Registration; SAFE intake program as required by Dept and any follow up as required; Any other assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate; On Cts. 1, 6 and 7>>DA assessment to be paid; CC on all counts; On Ct. 1>>DNA surcharge and provide provide DNA sample; DNA surcharge on other counts is remitted; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or for any week that is not accomplished, defendant must complete 10 hours CS/week; No contact w/victims C.L., C.L., or C.P.

>>COURT finds Defendant does NOT qualify for CIP or SAP on any counts.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 10:32am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Atty Bohn.
(Continuation of Motion hearing from 7/30/15)

COURT notes issues for today -- Motion to Compel address, MIL filed by defense, and issue pertaining to incamera inspection.

COURT addresses Defense Motion to Compel address of witness>>
State makes argument on motion - COURT grants Motion to disclose address.
State requests that the defendant himself not be given address of witness; COURT orders that the address itself is only to counsel for purposes of serving subpoena, and shall not be disclosed to anyone else including defendant.

COURT addresses Defense MIL>>
State makes statement as to Subpart 1 -- COURT questions parties regarding entry of plea to Ct. 5 w/deferred entry conditioned on outcome of trial; Parties will discuss and matter will be put on record before start of trial.
2 - State does not object; COURT grants
3 - State does not object; COURT grants

COURT Addresses Def Request of Incamera Inspection of school records>>
COURT has reviewed records and finds no discoverable information; COURT makes further findings on discovery issues.
Records to remain sealed and may not be viewed unless per court order.

Atty Bohn addresses motion previously ruled upon regarding evidence on consent; COURT questions State regarding introduction of evidence at trial - State responds.
COURT makes rulings.
COURT questions parties if 3 days will suffice for trial - both agree it will; COURT directs defendant be provided civilian clothing for trial - Atty Bohn will take care of that issue.
Bond continues.

Adj: 10:56am
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena mailed to J.G. 8/20/15)
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena hand delivered to C.J. 8/20/15)

Motion hearing at 08-21-2015 10:30 am.
Jury Trial at 09-15-2015 09:00 am.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:30pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Lou Ann Bohn.
(Motions filed by both State and Defense)

COURT notes motions to be addressed filed by both parties and counsel state agreement on the issues that need to be ruled upon today.
COURT also notes receipt recently of voluminous records from school w/cover letter stating they are for in camera inspection - that issue will be addressed after motions completed.

COURT addresses State's MIL which include 8 Subparts>>
1 - Atty Bohn does not object - COURT grants.
2 - Atty Bohn does not object - COURT grants.
3 - Arguments by Atty Bohn - COURT makes rulings.
4 - Atty Bohn does not object - COURT grants.
5 - Arguments by both counsel - COURT makes rulings and grants.
6 - COURT questions Atty Bohn if defense will require/file Miranda/Goodchild motion - Atty Bohn states no such motion is appropriate and therefore will not be filed; State notes they have no Miranda/Goodchild issues.
7 - COURT grants with additional rulings.
8 - No objection - COURT grants and directs parties to remind COURT to put information inquiring of defendant before trial begins.

COURT addresses State's Motion re: Defendant's Prior Convictions for Purposes of Impeachment>>
Argument on motion by Atty Bohn; COURT makes rulings - number to be referred to would be 3.

COURT addresses Defense Motion on Rape Sheild/ to Introduce Evidence in Affidavits/Motion Concerning Past Sexual Conduct>>
State is objecting to introduction; Argument by Atty Bohn; COURT questions Atty Bohn regarding certain subparts and probative values; Argument by State.
COURT makes rulings - allows portions in as discussed.

COURT addresses State's Motion re: Other Evidence Concerning Prior Sexual Conduct>>
Atty Bohn does not object but also requests ruling also preclude State from doing same; Response by State, and COURT questions Atty Bohn on issue of possible testimony.
COURT makes rulings - Motion granted with exceptions as stated.

Atty Bohn states Motions filed 7/16 Motion to compel disclosure of address and Additional defense motion in limine; COURT has not received/reviewed and will need a seperate hearing date on those motions.

Atty Bohn states COURT has received school records per a subpoena that was sent to them by defense, and is requesting in camera review by COURT of 2 witnesses; COURT questions Atty Bohn on statute allowing for review of these records and preliminary showing. Argument by State.
COURT sets briefing schedule on issue of school records: Defense brief due in 10 days, State response due 7 days thereafter and Defense reply must be filed thereafter no less than 10 days prior to Motion hearing date that parties will need to schedule after this hearing concludes.

COURT ORDERS school records that have been received must be SEALED and cannot be viewed except upon ruling of the COURT.
Adj: 2:36pm
School Records -In Camera Inspection- ORDERED SEALED

COURT notes understanding of adjournment of this hearing requested by State as to its motions - COURT  not prepared for Defense motion today.

COURT resets all pending motions in this case for 7/30/15 at 1:30pm for one hour.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 3:11pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Lou Ann Bohn.
(Motion re: Other Acts/Rape Shield)

COURT questions parties if Defense MIL and Defense Other Acts motions are the only at issue today - both parties state another MH will be needed as State will be filing Other Acts motion and MIL, and Defense may also be filing another motion.
COURT reads statutes regarding motions to counsel, and COURT requires affidavits from witness that would be testifying at motion hearing from both parties.
COURT will allow Defense to amend Motions to include such affidavits, and directs that affidavits will be required from either party on any further motions.

Defense motion dated 5/15/15>>
State does not object to following subparts>>1-5, 7, 12-15; COURT grants all subparts.
COURT questions if clothing will be coordinated for defendant - Attorney Bohn states that will be accomplished.
#6 - COURT grants unless by further order by COURT.
#8 - COURT grants as agreed upon by parties as stated.
#9 - State does not expect any court officer to handle evidence or assist at counsel table; COURT grants but State may revisit issue at a later date if necessary.
#10 - Argument by State on this subsection - Attorney Bohn states agreement; COURT grants.
#11 - COURT grants as agreed upon by parties as stated.

Parties to set MH for approximately 2 hours - Motions MUST be filed no later than 10 days prior to date; If filing with COC, parties must simultaneously file a copy with Judicial Assistant in Br. 4.

Adj: 3:27pm
